data.scheme_name: Chief Minister Employment Generation Programme (CMEGP) - General Male
data.benefits: Scheme provides capital subsidy benefit of 15% - 25% of project cost subject to maximum Rs. 20 lakhs - 50 Lakhs.
data.eligibility:
Age :- 18 to 45
Special category (including SC/ST/Women/ Ex-servicemen/Differently abled) :- 18 to 50
Applicant(s) should be resident of Maharashtra.
data.conditions: Only one person from a family will be eligible under the scheme. (Definition of family includes Self and spouse)
data.beneficiaries:
The Age of the applicant should be between 18 to 45. For Special category (including SC/ST/Women/ Ex-servicemen/Differently abled) age is relaxed by 5 years.
Applicant(s) should be resident of Maharashtra. In case of birth outside Maharashtra, the applicant must possess domicile certificate.
For project/units cost between Rs.10 lakh to Rs.25 lakhs, the required educational criteria for the applicant is minimum 7th standard pass and for project/units above Rs.25 lakh the required educational criteria for the applicant is minimum 10th standard pass. The applicants should also preferably possess respective / relevant skills required for the project
data.prerequisites: Only one person from a family will be eligible under the scheme. (Definition of family includes Self and spouse)
data.context: Government of Maharashtra has approved the introduction of a new credit linked subsidy programme called Chief Minister Employment Generation Programme (CMEGP) for generation of employment opportunities through establishment of Micro & Small Enterprises (project cost limited to Rs. 50 lacs) in rural as well as urban areas in the state.
data.objective: To establish 1,00,000 Micro and Small Enterprises in the next five years and achieve employment opportunities to 8-10 lakh youth in the State
data.description:
Quantum and Nature of Financial Assistance:- 
Beneficiary’s Contribution (of project cost): 10% 
Rate of Subsidy (of project cost):
Urban: 15%
Rural: 25%
The maximum cost of the project/unit admissible under manufacturing sector is Rs.50 lakh.
The maximum cost of the project/unit admissible under service , Agro-based/ Primary Agro processing sector, E-vehicle based goods transport and other businesses, single brand service ventures (single brand-based chains, mobile service ventures) is Rs.20 lakhs.
data.funding_mechanism:
1. The Bank will sanction a loan of 90% of the project cost in case of General Category of beneficiary/institution and 95% in case of special category of the beneficiary/institution and disburse full amount suitably for setting up of the project where the term loan disbursement shall either be one-time or phase-wise depending upon the nature of the project. 

2. The Bank will finance Capital Expenditure in the form of Term Loan and Working Capital in the form of Cash Credit. Project can also be financed by the bank in the form of Composite Loan consisting of Capital Expenditure and Working Capital.
data.additional_info:
EDP Training and Margin Money Claim:- EDP Training Completion: - After completing EDP training from approved agencies, the applicant’s bank will upload the training certificate on the portal with the Margin Money claim. - Margin Money claims are allowed only after the first installment of the loan is disbursed and equals or exceeds the Margin Money amount. 

Eligibility Restrictions: - Units that have received benefits under PMRY, REGP, PMEGP, or other government subsidy schemes are not eligible. 

Margin Money Handling: - Margin money will be held in a Term Deposit Receipt (TDR) for three years, earning no interest. - After three years and successful loan repayment, the Margin Money will be converted to grant-in-aid in the loan account, pending validation from GM, DIC. 

Area Classification: - Areas with populations ≤ 20,000 (2011 census) are classified as rural; those with > 20,000 are urban. - Nagar Panchayats and areas developed by MIDC with populations ≤ 20,000 are also classified as urban. 

Negative Industries List: - Industries related to: - Meat processing/slaughtering, intoxicants (e.g., tobacco products). - Cultivation of certain crops (e.g., tea, coffee). - Animal husbandry (e.g., poultry, goat/sheep rearing). - Manufacturing of banned plastic products. - Any other activities banned by the government.
data.checklist_info_a:
1. Registration document of enterprise                                          
      2. Project budget                                                                                 
3. Marksheet of the applicant of his highest education               
4. Udyam Registration Certificate 
5. The license of business  
      6. Other KYC documents
data.beneficiary: Specific Industries - Proprietorship, Partnership and Self-Help Groups, Limited Liability Partnership (LLP) - Maharashtra - Micro and Small
